name: Bratislava
fun_fact: Fun fact: Bratislava is the only capital in the world that borders TWO other countries - Austria and Hungary are both just a bike ride away, creating a unique tri-national cultural zone where you can have breakfast in Slovakia, lunch in Austria, and dinner in Hungary.

hero_dishes.description: Slovakia's national dish - potato dumplings covered in bryndza (creamy, tangy sheep's milk cheese) and topped with crispy fried bacon bits
hero_dishes.origin_story: This hearty comfort food originated in the Tatra Mountains among shepherds who made cheese from their sheep's milk. It's now the ultimate Slovak comfort food that every restaurant serves
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Slovak Pub (11-room establishment in 150-year-old cottage), Koliba Kamz√≠k, Viecha U Sedliaka

hero_dishes.name: Kapustnica
hero_dishes.description: Cabbage soup made with fermented sauerkraut, smoked sausage, mushrooms, and sometimes dried plums - smoky, sour, and slightly sweet
hero_dishes.origin_story: This Christmas staple is eaten throughout the winter months. The addition of dried plums is distinctly Slovak, creating a complex flavor that balances sour, smoky, and sweet
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Modr√° Hviezda (Blue Star - in brick cellar under castle), Bratislava Flagship Restaurant

hero_dishes.name: Pirohy
hero_dishes.description: Small filled dumplings with bryndza cheese, mashed potatoes, sauerkraut, or sweet fillings, served with melted butter and bacon
hero_dishes.origin_story: Similar to Polish pierogi but with distinctly Slovak fillings like bryndza cheese. These are comfort food that grandmothers make for special occasions
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Viecha U Sedliaka (best value), traditional koliba restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Roasted Duck with Braised Cabbage
hero_dishes.description: Duck roasted until the skin is crispy, served with sweet-and-sour braised red cabbage and bread dumplings
hero_dishes.origin_story: This winter holiday dish shows Austrian and Hungarian influences on Slovak cuisine. The combination of rich duck fat and tangy cabbage is perfectly balanced
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Bratislava Flagship Restaurant (in old theatre), Modr√° Hviezda

signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At Slovak Pub where they brew their own beer on-site, or at Bratislavsk√Ω Me≈°tiansky Pivovar. Beer is the national drink and is consumed with every meal

signature_drinks.name: Slivovica
signature_drinks.description: Potent traditional plum brandy - clear, strong, and aromatic
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served as a digestive after heavy meals. Every Slovak family makes their own version, and the homemade stuff is always stronger than what you can buy
